channel.title: Made our lovely planet Earth
channel.description:
Alright, this is my result after 1 hour working on our lovely globe in 3DS Max, this has an appart layer for landscape and seas, an appart layer for clouds, an appart layer for our atmosphere and an appart layer for the environment. Tell me what you think. I could like make the difference between landscape and seas but I think it would be useless because it already looks pretty badass.
[b]Credits: 90% to me 4% to NASA for the earth texture 4% to NASA for the clouds texture 2% to NASA for the environmet texture And I'm serious, those textures are from NASA's database.[/b]
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll242/VregScapeOwner/theearth.jpg[/img]
[b]PROOVE THAT THIS IS MINE:[/b]
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll242/VregScapeOwner/theearthproove.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll242/VregScapeOwner/Untitdfgdfgdgled.png[/img]
[b]EDIT: NEW VIEWS FOR FRELL:[/b]
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll242/VregScapeOwner/earthfront.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll242/VregScapeOwner/earth3Ds.jpg[/img]
[b]EDIT: HERE IS A 1920 x 1200 VIEW AND THE LANDSCAPE AND SEA TEXTURE OF THE MODEL:[/b]
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll242/VregScapeOwner/hdearth.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll242/VregScapeOwner/worldtopobathy2004083x5400x27000.jpg[/img]
[b][size=18pt]FULL HD BEAUTIFUL ANIMATION COMING SOON, MY LAPTOP IS 2 WEAK TO RENDER IT, MY FRIENDS BEAST COMPUTER IS GOING TO RENDER IT FOR ME IN FULL HD[/size][/b]

I think google did a better job with Google Earth

item.title: Made our lovely planet Earth
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:14, topic:334960”][img]http://fc00.deviantart.net/fs50/f/2009/293/c/7/Earth_2_by_Frell262.png

STH, i made ^^ with the exact same textures Mista is using.

nvm he used the greenish panzie texture that isnt realistic. But its from the exact same site.[/quote]

Yeah, I know the site.

What I’m saying is, he’s done something with them.

Look in some images. It looks like the before version of a 3D image you need glasses to view. It looks like a double image which makes it look blurrier. It’s not sharp. Something like this isn’t obviously trying to be realistic, so I don’t care about the laws of physics and how it would actually look viewed from space, I want a sharp ass image of the Earth which shows crazy detail.

Otherwise, it’s the easiest animation ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Made our lovely planet Earth
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:13, topic:334960”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=431351.msg3167406#msg3167406 date=1270141195]

Doesn’t matter if you have a “full HD beautiful” animation because your textures are NOT for HD. It will not be beautiful.
[/quote]what u mean by not for hd? my textures are 5400 x 2700 pixels, i think thats hd enough

EDIT: thats doesn’t look that HD because its rendered in 1280 x 800 since my laptop isnt that powerfull i could render it in 1080p but it would take long, infact, ill render it beyond tht and ill render it in 1920 x 1200 with an aspect regio of 16:4 wich is better than 1080p hd and you’'ll see what hd really is, dont care if it will take long, ill upp a pic for you as soon as it finished rendering

That’s not why it doesn’t look that HD. We don’t give a shit how big your textures are or where you got them, we all know how and where to get them also. The bottom line is, in your images your textures suck.

I know what HD is and you obviously don’t. You can render in the HD format but because your textures look bad already they will look even worse. They’re blurry and some pictures have a double image feeling. Why bother rendering a huge size when the content won’t look better that way?[/quote]whatever you say, im not in the mood for a comeback,

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell

STH, i made ^^ with the exact same textures Mista is using.

nvm he used the greenish panzie texture that isnt realistic. But its from the exact same site.

item.title: Made our lovely planet Earth
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:11, topic:334960”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=431351.msg3167345#msg3167345 date=1270135546]
Doesn’t matter if you have a “full HD beautiful” animation because your textures are NOT for HD. It will not be beautiful.
[/quote]what u mean by not for hd? my textures are 5400 x 2700 pixels, i think thats hd enough

EDIT: thats doesn’t look that HD because its rendered in 1280 x 800 since my laptop isnt that powerfull i could render it in 1080p but it would take long, infact, ill render it beyond tht and ill render it in 1920 x 1200 with an aspect regio of 16:4 wich is better than 1080p hd and you’'ll see what hd really is, dont care if it will take long, ill upp a pic for you as soon as it finished rendering[/quote]

That’s not why it doesn’t look that HD. We don’t give a shit how big your textures are or where you got them, we all know how and where to get them also. The bottom line is, in your images your textures suck.

I know what HD is and you obviously don’t. You can render in the HD format but because your textures look bad already they will look even worse. They’re blurry and some pictures have a double image feeling. Why bother rendering a huge size when the content won’t look better that way?

Read full topic

item.title: Made our lovely planet Earth
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:11, topic:334960”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=431351.msg3167345#msg3167345 date=1270135546]
Doesn’t matter if you have a “full HD beautiful” animation because your textures are NOT for HD. It will not be beautiful.
[/quote]what u mean by not for hd? my textures are 5400 x 2700 pixels, i think thats hd enough

EDIT: thats doesn’t look that HD because its rendered in 1280 x 800 since my laptop isnt that powerfull i could render it in 1080p but it would take long, infact, ill render it beyond tht and ill render it in 1920 x 1200 with an aspect regio of 16:4 wich is better than 1080p hd and you’'ll see what hd really is, dont care if it will take long, ill upp a pic for you as soon as it finished rendering[/quote]
massive resolution doesnt mean high definition, if you expand a picture from say 100x200 by a factor of 10 it isnt suddenly an HD image. Also you dont get 1080p images iirc, the p refers to the progressive rendering of frames within a video, you get the 1080 resolution thats it. And STH is right, they arent HD textures they are just massive images, not the same

Read full topic

thats the one instant shift have indexed, ps your startfield is shocking it makes everything look way too unrealistic[/quote]mine belongs in a game environment however, the one in that tut was more realistic, it depends on the textures, if i used a more realistic texture and an other atmosphere it would look more realistic but thats not the effect im trying to get here, im going for something special not an exact copy of the earth
